name: df-sgrp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(csgrp, crab(s0, cmgm, wsbc(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cv(s1), wral(s5, cv(s1), wceq(co(co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4)), cv(s2), cv(s5)), co(cv(s3), cv(s2), co(cv(s4), cv(s2), cv(s5)))))))))))
comment: A _semigroup_ is a set equipped with an everywhere defined internal operation (so, a magma, see ~ df-mgm ), whose operation is associative. Definition in section II.1 of [Bruck] p. 23, or of an "associative magma" in definition 5 of [BourbakiAlg1] p. 4 . (Contributed by FL, 2-Nov-2009.) (Revised by AV, 6-Jan-2020.)
